byline.original: By AL BAKER and ASHLEY SOUTHALL

abstract: New York City Police Dept's long-delayed internal case against Officer Richard Haste, who fatally shot unarmed black teenager Ramarley Graham in Bronx in 2012, will proceed now that federal prosecutors have decided against filing criminal charges.
lead_paragraph: An internal case against Officer Richard Haste will proceed now that federal prosecutors have declined to charge him in the death of Mr. Graham, who was 18 when he was killed in his Bronx apartment.

headline.main: Officer in Fatal Shooting of Ramarley Graham Faces Police Dept. Charges
headline.print_headline: Officer in 2012 Killing of a Bronx Teenager Faces Police Dept. Charges

snippet: An internal case against Officer Richard Haste will proceed now that federal prosecutors have declined to charge him in the death of Mr. Graham, who was 18 when he was killed in his Bronx apartment.
